title: PHP/Apache (Debian)
description: The official PHP/Apache image on Debian Linux (php:latest) with selectable version and other options
notes: Valid PHP image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/_/php/tags)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: VERSION
env.label: PHP version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the Trafex Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx/tags)

env.name: PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the php server (check that it is not in use)

env.name: PHP_EXTENSIONS
env.label: Additional extensions
env.description: Comma-separated list of additional PHP extensions to install - without spaces! (e.g. 'pgsql,pdo_mysql,sqlite3,odbc,redis,imagick,bcmath,imap,ldap,soap,tidy,xmlrpc,zlib')

env.name: PHP_MEMORY_LIMIT
env.label: Memory limit
env.description: PHP script memory limit (128M is the default but 256M or 512M is recommended)

env.name: PHP_WEB_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Path on host to use for the PHP application root. For Windows, enclose in quotes and escape path separators with double-backslashes.

env.name: RESTART
env.label: Restart
env.description: Restart behavior (on failure or Docker engine restart)
